intro: Casearia yucatanensis, commonly known as the Yucatan casearia, is a shrub native to the Yucatán Peninsula in Mexico. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and small, white to pale yellow flowers that appear in clusters. It produces small, fleshy berries that are typically red when ripe. This species is often found in coastal areas and is adapted to sandy soils and saline conditions.
